description.narrative: By 2020, community-based child protection mechanisms have increased capacity to prevent and respond to child protection risks and violations,which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participationBy 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, community-based child protection mechanisms have increased capacity to prevent and respond to child protection risks and violations

description.narrative: The community-based child protection services, implemented in partnership with the Government of Turkey and NGOs in response to the Syria refugee and migrant crisis has continued to provide multi-disciplinary services for over 200,000 vulnerable refugee and Turkish children and their families. A 2019 evaluation of the CBCP found that the variety of services offered with a multi-sector and holistic approach in the centres has been relevant in meeting children's needs and has adapted over time, providing critical additional service points to increase the coverage and quality of protection services at the local level and promote inclusion and resilience. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of UNICEF-targeted girls and boys in humanitarian situations provided with psychosocial support, including access to child friendly spaces with intersectoral programming interventions
